snippet: Faced with another bloody massacre, Republicans in the Senate killed a measure to keep guns away from suspected terrorists.
abstract: Editorial excoriates Senate Republicans for voting against gun control measures, including legislation to prevent people on FBI's terrorist watchlist from purchasing firearms, just days after mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif; assails Republicans for offering political attacks and terrorism-related fear-mongering in lieu of practical action; holds Republicans' alleged willingness to take action against terrorists overseas is brought sharply into question by their absolute reluctance to act at home.
lead_paragraph: Faced with another bloody massacre, Republicans in the Senate killed a measure to keep guns away from suspected terrorists.

headline.print_headline: Tough Talk and a Cowardly Vote
headline.main: Tough Talk and a Cowardly Vote on Terrorism
